titleInfo.title: Letter from Lieutenant James Longden Stevens, Commander of the Honourable Company's Sloop Clive,Near Bushire, to Commodore George Robinson, Commander of the Squadron in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: In this letter Lieutenant James Longden Stevens, Commander of the Honourable Company's sloop Clive,provides details of how he intervened on behalf of his servant, Goolam Ali, who was put in prison for detaining clothes belonging to one of Stevens's former servants, a man named Abool. Stevens states that he detained Abool's clothes because he had stolen money from him. He writes that he gave the clothes to Goolam Ali and instructed him not to deliver them without his orders. A note on the verso of this letter states that it was originally an enclosure to letter no. 139, dated 15 September, from Commander George Robinson.
